member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControl.CheckPropertyChangeAllowed(System.String)
member.summary: Calls the hosting dialog, if it exists, to check whether the property can be set in the dialog's current state. The host should throw an exception if the change is not supported. Note that if the dialog isn't set yet, there are no restrictions on setting the property.
member.param: The name of the property that is changing

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControl.ApplyPropertyChange(System.String)
member.summary: Calls the hosting dialog, if it exists, to to indicate that a property has changed, and that the dialog should do whatever is necessary to propagate the change to the native control. Note that if the dialog isn't set yet, there are no restrictions on setting the property.
member.param: The name of the property that is changing.

member.name: T:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods
member.summary: Wrappers for Native Methods and Structs. This type is intended for internal use only

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. The SendMessage function calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. The SendMessage function calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. The SendMessage function calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.DestroyIcon(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Destroys an icon and frees any memory the icon occupied.
member.param: Handle to the icon to be destroyed. The icon must not be in use.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network
member.summary: Represents a network on the local machine. It can also represent a collection of network connections with a similar network signature.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are obtained by calling methods on the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the category of a network. The categories are trusted, untrusted, or authenticated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.ConnectedTime
member.summary: Gets the local date and time when the network was connected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.Connections
member.summary: Gets the network connections for the network.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.Connectivity
member.summary: Gets the connectivity state of the network.
member.remarks: Connectivity provides information on whether the network is connected, and the protocols in use for network traffic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.CreatedTime
member.summary: Gets the local date and time when the network was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description for the network.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.DomainType
member.summary: Gets the domain type of the network.
member.remarks: The domain indictates whether the network is an Active Directory Network, and whether the machine has been authenticated by Active Directory.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether there is network connectivity.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether there is Internet connectivity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the network.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Network.NetworkId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the network.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings
member.summary: Specifies the options for an application to be automatically restarted by Windows Error Reporting.
member.remarks: Regardless of these settings, the application will not be restarted if it executed for less than 60 seconds before terminating.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RestartSettings class.
member.param: The command line arguments used to restart the application.
A bitwise combination of the RestartRestrictions values that specify when the application should not be restarted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the current state of this object.
member.returns: A that displays the command line arguments and restrictions for restarting the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings.Command
member.summary: Gets the command line arguments used to restart the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets the set of conditions when the application should not be restarted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager
member.summary: Enables registration for power-related event notifications and provides access to power settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.GetCurrentBatteryState
member.summary: Gets a snapshot of the current battery state.
member.returns: A instance that represents the state of the battery at the time this method was called.
member.exception: The system does not have a battery.
Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.

member.name: E:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.PowerPersonalityChanged
member.summary: Raised each time the active power scheme changes.
member.exception: The event handler specified for removal was not registered.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: E:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.PowerSourceChanged
member.summary: Raised when the power source changes.
member.exception: The event handler specified for removal was not registered.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: E:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.BatteryLifePercentChanged
member.summary: Raised when the remaining battery life changes.
member.exception: The event handler specified for removal was not registered.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: E:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.IsMonitorOnChanged
member.summary: Raised when the monitor status changes.
member.exception: The event handler specified for removal was not registered.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: E:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.SystemBusyChanged
member.summary: Raised when the system will not be moving into an idle state in the near future so applications should perform any tasks that would otherwise prevent the computer from entering an idle state.
member.exception: The event handler specified for removal was not registered.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.MonitorRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the monitor is set to remain active.
member.exception: Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.
The caller does not have sufficient privileges to set this property.
member.remarks: This information is typically used by applications that display information but do not require user interaction. For example, video playback applications.
member.permission: to set this property. Demand value: ; Named Permission Sets: FullTrust.
member.value: A value. True if the monitor is required to remain on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.RequestBlockSleep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the system is required to be in the working state.
member.exception: Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.
The caller does not have sufficient privileges to set this property.
member.permission: to set this property. Demand value: ; Named Permission Sets: FullTrust.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.IsBatteryPresent
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a battery is present. The battery can be a short term battery.
member.exception: Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.IsBatteryShortTerm
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the battery is a short term battery.
member.exception: Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.IsUpsPresent
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates a UPS is present to prevent sudden loss of power.
member.exception: Requires XP/Windows Server 2003 or higher.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.PowerPersonality
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the current power scheme.
member.exception: Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.BatteryLifePercent
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the remaining battery life (as a percentage of the full battery charge). This value is in the range 0-100, where 0 is not charged and 100 is fully charged.
member.exception: The system does not have a battery.
Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.IsMonitorOn
member.summary: Gets a value that indictates whether the monitor is on.
member.exception: Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerManager.PowerSource
member.summary: Gets the current power source.
member.exception: Requires Vista/Windows Server 2008.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkConnection.DomainType

member.returns: A representation of this object's current state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.ACOnline
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the battery charger is operating on external power.
member.value: A value. True indicates the battery charger is operating on AC power.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.MaxCharge
member.summary: Gets the maximum charge of the battery (in mW).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.CurrentCharge
member.summary: Gets the current charge of the battery (in mW).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.DischargeRate
member.summary: Gets the rate of discharge for the battery (in mW).
member.remarks: A negative value indicates the charge rate. Not all batteries support charge rate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.EstimatedTimeRemaining
member.summary: Gets the estimated time remaining until the battery is empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.SuggestedCriticalBatteryCharge
member.summary: Gets the manufacturer's suggested battery charge level that should cause a critical alert to be sent to the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.BatteryState.SuggestedBatteryWarningCharge
member.summary: Gets the manufacturer's suggested battery charge level that should cause a warning to be sent to the user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.IDialogControlHost
member.summary: Indicates that the implementing class is a dialog that can host customizable dialog controls (subclasses of DialogControl).

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.IDialogControlHost.IsCollectionChangeAllowed
member.summary: Handle notifications of pseudo-controls being added or removed from the collection. PreFilter should throw if a control cannot be added/removed in the dialog's current state. PostProcess should pass on changes to native control, if appropriate.
member.returns: true if collection change is allowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.IDialogControlHost.ApplyCollectionChanged
member.summary: Applies changes to the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.IDialogControlHost.IsControlPropertyChangeAllowed(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControl)
member.summary: Handle notifications of individual child pseudo-controls' properties changing.. Prefilter should throw if the property cannot be set in the dialog's current state. PostProcess should pass on changes to native control, if appropriate.
member.returns: true if the property change is allowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.IDialogControlHost.ApplyControlPropertyChange(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControl)
member.summary: Called when a control currently in the collection has a property changed.
member.param: The name of the property changed.
The control whose property has changed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1
member.summary: Strongly typed collection for dialog controls.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1.InsertItem(System.Int32,`0)
member.summary: Inserts an dialog control at the specified index.
member.param: The location to insert the control.
member.permission: A control with the same name already exists in this collection -or- the control is being hosted by another dialog -or- the associated dialog is showing and cannot be modified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1.RemoveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the control at the specified index.
member.param: The location of the control to remove.
member.permission: The associated dialog is showing and cannot be modified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1.GetControlbyId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Recursively searches for the control who's id matches the value passed in the parameter.
member.param: An integer containing the identifier of the control being searched for.
member.returns: A DialogControl who's id matches the value of the parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1.GetSubControlbyId(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Recursively searches for a given control id in the collection passed via the parameter.
member.param: An int containing the identifier of the control being searched for.
member.returns: A DialogControl who's Id matches the value of the parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.DialogControlCollection`1.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Defines the indexer that supports accessing controls by name.

remarks.para: This indexer is useful when the dialog is created in XAML rather than constructed in code.

member.exception: The name cannot be null or a zero-length string.
member.remarks: If there is more than one control with the same name, only the first control will be returned.

member.summary: Specifies the conditions when Windows Error Reporting should not restart an application that has registered for automatic restart.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.None
member.summary: Always restart the application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnCrash
member.summary: Do not restart when the application has crashed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnHang
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is hung.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnPatch
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is terminated due to a system update.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnReboot
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is terminated because of a system reboot.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings
member.summary: Defines methods and properties for recovery settings, and specifies options for an application that attempts to perform final actions after a fatal event, such as an unhandled exception.
member.remarks: This class is used to register for application recovery. See the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RecoverySettings class.
member.param: A recovery data object that contains the callback method (invoked by the system before Windows Error Reporting terminates the application) and an optional state object.
The time interval within which the callback method must invoke to prevent WER from terminating the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the current state of this object.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings.RecoveryData
member.summary: Gets the recovery data object that contains the callback method and an optional parameter (usually the state of the application) to be passed to the callback method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings.PingInterval
member.summary: Gets the time interval for notifying Windows Error Reporting. The method must invoke within this interval to prevent WER from terminating the application.
member.remarks: The recovery ping interval is specified in milliseconds. By default, the interval is 5 seconds. If you specify zero, the default interval is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.NativeTaskDialog
member.summary: Encapsulates the native logic required to create, configure, and show a TaskDialog, via the TaskDialogIndirect() Win32 function.
member.remarks: A new instance of this class should be created for each messagebox show, as the HWNDs for TaskDialogs do not remain constant across calls to TaskDialogIndirect.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerSource
member.summary: Specifies the power source currently supplying power to the system.
member.remarks: Application should be aware of the power source because some power sources provide a finite power supply. An application might take steps to conserve power while the system is using such a source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerSource.AC
member.summary: The computer is powered by an AC power source or a similar device, such as a laptop powered by a 12V automotive adapter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerSource.Battery
member.summary: The computer is powered by a built-in battery. A battery has a limited amount of power; applications should conserve resources where possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.PowerSource.Ups
member.summary: The computer is powered by a short-term power source such as a UPS device.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.Power.RegisterPowerSettingNotification(System.IntPtr,System.Guid)
member.summary: Registers the application to receive power setting notifications for the specific power setting event.
member.param: Handle indicating where the power setting notifications are to be sent.
The GUID of the power setting for which notifications are to be sent.
member.returns: Returns a notification handle for unregistering power notifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.Power.SetThreadExecutionState(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ExecutionState)
member.summary: Allows an application to inform the system that it is in use, thereby preventing the system from entering the sleeping power state or turning off the display while the application is running.
member.exception: Thrown if the SetThreadExecutionState call fails.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar
member.summary: Provides a visual representation of the progress of a long running operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class with the specified name. And using the default values: Min = 0, Max = 100, Current = 0

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class with the specified minimum, maximum and current values.
member.param: The minimum value for this control.
The maximum value for this control.
The current value for this control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.Reset
member.summary: Resets the control to its minimum value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogProgressBar.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value for the control.

member.name: T:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.SafeRegionHandle
member.summary: Safe Region Handle

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.SafeRegionHandle.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: Release the handle
member.returns: true if handled is release successfully, false otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager
member.summary: This class generates .NET events based on Windows messages. The PowerRegWindow class processes the messages from Windows.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.RegisterPowerEvent(System.Guid,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Registers a callback for a power event.
member.param: Event handler for the specified event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.UnregisterPowerEvent(System.Guid,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Unregisters an event handler for a power event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.EnsureInitialized
member.summary: Ensures that the hidden window is initialized and listening for messages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.PowerRegWindow
member.summary: Catch Windows messages and generates events for power specific messages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.PowerRegWindow.RegisterPowerEvent(System.Guid,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Adds an event handler to call when Windows sends a message for an evebt.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.PowerRegWindow.UnregisterPowerEvent(System.Guid,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Removes an event handler.
member.exception: Cannot unregister a function that is not registered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.PowerRegWindow.ExecuteEvents(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Executes any registered event handlers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.MessageManager.PowerRegWindow.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: This method is called when a Windows message is sent to this window. The method calls the registered event handlers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity
member.summary: Specifies types of network connectivity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.Disconnected
member.summary: The underlying network interfaces have no connectivity to any network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv4Internet
member.summary: There is connectivity to the Internet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv4LocalNetwork
member.summary: There is connectivity to a routed network using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv4NoTraffic
member.summary: There is connectivity to a network, but the service cannot detect any IPv4 network traffic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv4Subnet
member.summary: There is connectivity to the local subnet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv6Internet
member.summary: There is connectivity to the Internet using the IPv4 protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv6LocalNetwork
member.summary: There is connectivity to a local network using the IPv6 protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv6NoTraffic
member.summary: There is connectivity to a network, but the service cannot detect any IPv6 network traffic

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.Connectivity.IPv6Subnet
member.summary: There is connectivity to the local subnet using the IPv6 protocol.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.DomainType
member.summary: Specifies the domain type of a network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.DomainType.NonDomainNetwork
member.summary: The network is not an Active Directory network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.DomainType.DomainNetwork
member.summary: The network is an Active Directory network, but this machine is not authenticated against it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.DomainType.DomainAuthenticated
member.summary: The network is an Active Directory network, and this machine is authenticated against it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkCategory
member.summary: Specifies the trust level for a network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkCategory.Public
member.summary: The network is a public (untrusted) network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkCategory.Private
member.summary: The network is a private (trusted) network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkCategory.Authenticated
member.summary: The network is authenticated against an Active Directory domain.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkConnectivityLevels
member.summary:
Specifies the level of connectivity for networks returned by the
class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkConnectivityLevels.Connected
member.summary: Networks that the machine is connected to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkConnectivityLevels.Disconnected
member.summary: Networks that the machine is not connected to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Net.NetworkConnectivityLevels.All
member.summary: All networks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryCallback
member.summary: The that represents the callback method invoked by the system when an application has registered for application recovery.
member.param: An application-defined state object that is passed to the callback method.
member.remarks: The callback method will be invoked prior to the application being terminated by Windows Error Reporting (WER). To keep WER from terminating the application before the callback method completes, the callback method must periodically call the method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData
member.summary: Defines a class that contains a callback delegate and properties of the application as defined by the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a recovery data wrapper with a callback method and the current state of the application.
member.param: The current state of the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.Invoke
member.summary: Invokes the recovery callback function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the recovery callback function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.State
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the application state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult
member.summary: Indicates the various buttons and options clicked by the user on the task dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.Ok
member.summary: "OK" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.Yes
member.summary: "Yes" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.No
member.summary: "No" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.Cancel
member.summary: "Cancel" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.Retry
member.summary: "Retry" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.Close
member.summary: "Close" button was clicked

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.TaskDialogResult.CustomButtonClicked
member.summary: A custom button was clicked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager
member.summary: Provides access to the Application Restart and Recovery features available in Windows Vista or higher. Application Restart and Recovery lets an application do some recovery work to save data before the process exits.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.RegisterForApplicationRecovery(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RecoverySettings)
member.summary: Registers an application for recovery by Application Restart and Recovery.
member.param: An object that specifies the callback method, an optional parameter to pass to the callback method and a time interval.
member.exception: The registration failed due to an invalid parameter.
The registration failed.
member.remarks: The time interval is the period of time within which the recovery callback method calls the method to indicate that it is still performing recovery work.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.UnregisterApplicationRecovery
member.summary: Removes an application's recovery registration.
member.exception: The attempt to unregister for recovery failed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.UnregisterApplicationRestart
member.summary: Removes an application's restart registration.
member.exception: The attempt to unregister for restart failed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.ApplicationRecoveryInProgress
member.summary: Called by an application's method to indicate that it is still performing recovery work.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the user canceled the recovery.
member.exception: This method must be called from a registered callback method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.ApplicationRecoveryFinished(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called by an application's method to indicate that the recovery work is complete.
member.remarks: This should be the last call made by the method because Windows Error Reporting will terminate the application after this method is invoked.
member.param: true to indicate the the program was able to complete its recovery work before terminating; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.ApplicationRestartRecoveryManager.RegisterForApplicationRestart(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ApplicationServices.RestartSettings)
member.summary: Registers an application for automatic restart if the application is terminated by Windows Error Reporting.
member.param: An object that specifies the command line arguments used to restart the application, and the conditions under which the application should not be restarted.
member.exception: Registration failed due to an invalid parameter.
The attempt to register failed.
member.remarks: A registered application will not be restarted if it executed for less than 60 seconds before terminating.
